page.title: 08The Public House, Hilmarton.
page.content: The pub was built in 1873.The present owners Mr. and Mrs.Goddard moved in about two years ago. The whole pub has eleven rooms altogether, 5 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, one kitchen,two lounges and a bar.The beer garden has swings,a slide and a climbing frame. It also has chairs and tables.The outer buildings of the pub are 3 stables,a store room, an aviary and outside toilet.On busy days Mr.Goddard sells 6 gallons of beer. He gets his supplies from Arkells, who are joint owners.He stores beer and wine in his cellar.The pub sells mostly plate food. The favourite meal is ploughmans lunch. Mr. Goddard has 7 staff, most of whom are barmen and women.Mr.Goddard has 30 regular customers.The pub has a fruit machine, bar-billiards and sometimes singing. The Duke pub in Hilmarton is on the A.3102 Calne to Lyneham Road.
